Will Smith comparte un vídeo de su primera colonoscopia: "No se puede llegar a 50 millones de seguidores sin mostrar el trasero"
07 Nov 2019, 12:57 by Izabela Pecherska
El carismático actor Will Smith se ha propuesto llegar a los 50 millones de seguidores de Instagram (en la actualidad tiene 39.7 millones) y para ello ha compartido su primera colonoscopia con el mundo. 
"Dijeron que no se puede llegar a 50 millones de seguidores sin mostrar el trasero. Así que aquí estoy, compartiendo una colonoscopia a cambio de influencia", bromeó en su perfil de Instagram junto a un pequeño fragmento del vídeo de 17 minutos que ha publicado en Youtube, donde se ve el antes y después del procedimiento al que se sometió en Miami. 
Tras la recomendación de su doctora Ala Stanford, se animó a hacerse la colonoscopia. Y como Will no es nada tímido a la hora de mostrar los entresijos de su día a día ha grabado todo para animar a sus fans a que también pasen por ello. Sobre todo porque gracias a la prueba le detectaron a tiempo un pólipo precanceroso que le extirparon durante el examen. 



Es por esto que al final del clip, enfatizó en la importancia de someterse a estos controles dejando de lado cualquier tipo de vergüenza. "Sabemos que la detección y el diagnóstico temprano salvan vidas", le dijo el médico en una conversación posterior. 
Aunque la finalidad de este extenso material audiovisual es concienciar sobre la prevención de enfermedades, el actor no deja nunca de lado su sentido del humor y ha hecho de este vídeo lo más divertido posible. Y tras el examen, cuando todavía estaba aturdido por los medicamentos, se dirigió al médico como "el Martin Scorsese de su trasero".



Aunque se trata de un vídeo inusual, sus seguidores le han agradecido que haya compartido este proceso ya que anima a que los demás se revisen regularmente.
"Gracias Will. Esto tomó valor y estás salvando vidas con este tipo de vídeos", "Aprecio que estés usando tu plataforma para un mensaje tan importante", "Necesitamos terminar con el estigma", "Me alegro que atraparan ese pólipo temprano" o "Gracias Will por este blog. Mi esposo lo hará la próxima semana. Ahora tiene menos miedo", son algunos de los comentarios que se pueden leer debajo del vídeo.

Will Smith shares a video of his first colonoscopy: "You can't reach 50 million followers without showing your butt"
07 Nov 2019, 12:57 by Izabela Pecherska
The charismatic actor Will Smith has proposed to reach 50 million Instagram followers (currently has 39.7 million) and for this he has shared his first colonoscopy with the world.
"They said you can't reach 50 million followers without showing your butt. So here I am, sharing a colonoscopy in exchange for influence," he joked on his Instagram profile next to a small fragment of the 17-minute video he has published. on YouTube, where you see the before and after the procedure he underwent in Miami.
Following the recommendation of his doctor Ala Stanford, he was encouraged to have a colonoscopy. And since Will is not shy at the time of showing the ins and outs of his everyday life, he has recorded everything to encourage his fans to also go through it. Especially since thanks to the test he was detected in time a precancerous polyp that was removed during the exam.



This is why at the end of the clip, he emphasized the importance of undergoing these controls, leaving aside any type of shame. "We know that early detection and diagnosis save lives," the doctor told him in a subsequent conversation.
Although the purpose of this extensive audiovisual material is to raise awareness about disease prevention, the actor never neglects his sense of humor and has made this video as fun as possible. And after the exam, while he was still stunned by medications, he turned to the doctor as "the Martin Scorsese of his butt."



Although this is an unusual video, his followers have thanked him for sharing this process as it encourages others to review themselves regularly.
"Thank you Will. This took courage and you are saving lives with this kind of videos," "I appreciate that you are using your platform for such an important message," "We need to end the stigma," "I'm glad they caught that polyp early." "Thank you Will for this blog. My husband will do it next week. Now he's less afraid," are some of the comments that can be read under the video.
